subject: Re: [junit] how to use ExceptionTestCase ?
msgSnippet: Depends on your background.  The Smalltalk-ish new Block() speaks volumes to me. =jason
messageBody:
Depends on your background. The Smalltalk-ish new Block() speaks
volumes to me.

=jason

On Fri, 2003-05-23 at 08:46, Lucas wrote:
> in the 2nd piece of code you need as many lines as in the 1st piece,
> but code 1 communicates much better.
> so in my opinion it is not worth the hassle
>
> L
>
>
> Ilja Preuss wrote:
> >>Yes. I mention it in my book, but mainly so readers will
> >>know what it is when they see it... I go on to give the
> >>canonical way to test for
> >>exceptions:
> >>
> >>public void testForException() {
> >> try {
> >> doSomethingThatShouldThrowMyException();
> >> fail("MyException not thrown");
> >> } catch (MyException ex) {
> >> }
> >>}
> >
> >
> > We are currently trying something along the lines of
> >
> > public void testForException() {
> > assertThrows(MyException.class, new Block() {
> > public void execute() throws Exception {
> > doSomethingThatShouldThrowMyException();
> > }
> > });
> > }
> >
> > I think it communicates a little bit better, but haven't decided yet
> > wether it's worth the hassle...
> >
> > Regards, Ilja
> >
>
